title: [AWS S3] Seems like after upgrading to 1.52 it is mandatory to grant CreateBucket permission
body: #### What is the problem you are having with rclone? Related to AWS S3 remote Seems like after upgrading to `rclone` 1.52 it is mandatory to grant `CreateBucket` permission, otherwise even simple operations like `copy/copyto` or `move/moveto` are failing. #### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`) ``` rclone v1.52.0 - os/arch: linux/amd64 - go version: go1.14.3 ``` #### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit) ``` Distributor ID: Ubuntu Description: Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS Release: 16.04 Codename: xenial ``` #### Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive) AWS S3 #### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`) ``` rclone copy "/data/ongdb/data/backup/2020-06-02.tar.gz" "s3:redacted-bucket-name/backups/ongdb/staging" ``` #### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`) ``` 020/06/02 11:19:46 DEBUG :
